title: Dave1
author: Dave1
content: What Happened: Cryptocurrency lender Celsius who filed of Chapter 11 bankruptcy in mid July 2022, and exposed thousands of it's investors to suffer a big lost.But in the last couple of days, there have been emails circulating pretending to be be the from Stretto, the Claims Agent for the Celsius bankruptcy proceeding. And claims to offer creditors a 7-day exit window to claim their frozen funds.Website: Code: https://claims-stretto.com/So do not enter your email address, because once you entered a email address, it will prompt you to connect your wallet. And you know that once your connect your wallet, a bot will swipe every crypto assets you have.The website has just been registered:QuoteDomain Name: claims-stretto.comRegistry Domain ID: 2815369272_DOMAIN_COM-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: WHOIS.ENOM.COMRegistrar URL: WWW.ENOMDOMAINS.COMUpdated Date: 2023-09-19T21:45:26.00ZCreation Date: 2023-09-19T21:45:00.00ZRegistrar Registration Expiration Date: 2024-09-19T21:45:00.00ZRegistrar: ENOM, INC.Registrar IANA ID: 48Domain Status: addPeriod https://www.icann.org/epp#addPeriodDomain Status: clientTransferProhibited https://www.icann.org/epp#clientTransferProhibitedRegistrant Name: Whois Agent (279306283)Registrant Organization: Whois Privacy Protection Service, Inc.Registrant Street: PO Box 639Registrant Street: C/O claims-stretto.comRegistrant City: KirklandRegistrant State/Province: WARegistrant Postal Code: 98083Registrant Country: USRegistrant Phone: +1.4252740657Registrant Phone Ext: Registrant Fax: +1.4259744730Registrant Email: Admin Name: Whois AgentAdmin Organization: Whois Privacy Protection Service, Inc.Admin Street: PO Box 639Admin Street: C/O claims-stretto.comAdmin City: KirklandAdmin State/Province: WAAdmin Postal Code: 98083Admin Country: USAdmin Phone: +1.4252740657Admin Phone Ext: Admin Fax: +1.4259744730Admin Email: Tech Name: Whois AgentTech Organization: Whois Privacy Protection Service, Inc.Tech Street: PO Box 639Tech Street: C/O claims-stretto.comTech City: KirklandTech State/Province: WATech Postal Code: 98083Tech Country: USTech Phone: +1.4252740657Tech Phone Ext: Tech Fax: +1.4259744730Tech Email: Name Server: NS1.AMSTERDAM-HOSTING.TOName Server: NS2.AMSTERDAM-HOSTING.TODNSSEC: unsignedRegistrar Abuse Contact Email: Registrar Abuse Contact Phone: +1.4259744689URL of the ICANN WHOIS Data Problem Reporting System: http://HTTP://WDPRS.INTERNIC.NET/The legitimate website is: https://cases.stretto.com/celsius/claims/

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I fear that they may have obtained customer data from a data leak, and then they may obtain your name, email address, and account details, such as the remaining balance, which could be exploited to claim that this service is legitimate.These scammers are looking for any possible opportunity to steal money, it is best to verify the claim website from an official link and ignore any other links.I reported them ----> https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on September 20, 2023, 04:09:15 PMI fear that they may have obtained customer data from a data leak, and then they may obtain your name, email address, and account details, such as the remaining balance, which could be exploited to claim that this service is legitimate.These scammers are looking for any possible opportunity to steal money, it is best to verify the claim website from an official link and ignore any other links.I reported them ----> https://safebrowsing.google.com/safebrowsing/report_phish/Yeah, and probably this is the case here, and I guess not that this one, but all other scam attempts from customers of this X crypto services. But still good to hear this kind of warnings from this community.And maybe we have such victims from the Celsius bankruptcy and hopefully it can reach them and not be the next victims because it's going to be hard for them. I mean you lost already and trying to claim what is yours and suddenly to fall victim again.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: They want to take advantage of every situation to create a trick to fool people. These scammers are always busy creating strategies to scam people in the name of helping people in bad times. It's even more important to think about how the scammers got your email address and sent you the email with the phishing link. Now sharing your personal information on any website has become risky because someone is sitting on the other side to steal your information in any way. This is really a lot to think about

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: In every claims that we're seeing, there's also those scammers that tries to take advantage of the situation. Thanks OP when you've seen this and we need to alert everyone else upon seeing such fake claimant website or a phishing link that appears to be a copy cat of the legitimate ones. It's not just for the claims of celcius but also for other websites and services that has been gone and out of service already. This isn't going to be the last one that we'll see and there will be new ones that will be made by the scammers behind these fake websites and likely, they've been doing this all of their lifetime.

comments.author: TravelMug
comments.body: Quote from: tabas on September 20, 2023, 11:20:49 PMIn every claims that we're seeing, there's also those scammers that tries to take advantage of the situation. Thanks OP when you've seen this and we need to alert everyone else upon seeing such fake claimant website or a phishing link that appears to be a copy cat of the legitimate ones. It's not just for the claims of celcius but also for other websites and services that has been gone and out of service already. This isn't going to be the last one that we'll see and there will be new ones that will be made by the scammers behind these fake websites and likely, they've been doing this all of their lifetime. That is so true, and if I'm not mistaken, even the claimants from the Mt. Gox who has been one of the ghost that still haunting us for many years, has been taken advantage by this scammers and made several websites as well, fake ones obviously to trap those victims because it's been years and they want to claim it right now. So just be careful guys, this scammers are really that smart to know which incoming projects have filed for bankruptcy and what is the next step for their customers like how to claim and then they created this fake websites.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: TravelMug on September 21, 2023, 08:14:09 PMGox who has been one of the ghost that still haunting us for many years, has been taken advantage by this scammers and made several websites as well, fake ones obviously to trap those victims because it's been years and they want to claim it right now. So just be careful guys, this scammers are really that smart to know which incoming projects have filed for bankruptcy and what is the next step for their customers like how to claim and then they created this fake websites.Allow me to replace the word ‚Äúsmart‚Äù with ‚Äúmore informed‚Äù about the latest and old influential and prominent events in the market. They do not change and develop their fraudulent methods and schemes. They exploit the news and trending events and create phishing sites so that the victim can connect his wallet. They rush to send phishing emails to as many emails as possible that they receive in some way or through social media, especially Twitter.Our role here is to always alert people and Keep them up-to-date with scams like the OP did and report all fraudulent things carried out by scammers, because the market is not devoid of newcomers, of course.

comments.author: hg_away
comments.body: Quote from: albon on September 21, 2023, 10:20:52 PMThey exploit the news and trending events and create phishing sites so that the victim can connect his wallet. They rush to send phishing emails to as many emails as possible that they receive in some way or through social media, especially Twitter.Greed still exists, and it is one of the most important things that the fraudster is looking for, as the fear of losing money, greed, and the desire to obtain it make the person trust the first result that appears on Google or some paid articles, and here comes their role in trying to be the first to link or pay the authors of the articles, publish them. This way, it increases the likelihood that someone will search and find the fraudulent service.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Expect a lot of phishing sites whenever there is news of exchanges going down or filing bankruptcy, if you are updated on this scheme you'll know how to confirm it and where to confirm, these scammers know that people who lose a lot of money cannot think clearly and there is a desperation on their part to recover their money, and this is what this scammers are going after.Scammers kept doing this because they were getting victims and as long as they were getting victims on their scheme they just waited for the news and launched their phishing site, the authorities should keep reminding and educating people on how scammers do their thing.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: One of the things am more sensitive on in making business is in going through an agent when making an investment, they will set their own mode of operations different from the intended organizations and many have been using this also to deceive and scam other people, let's be very careful in using some sites, we have to be very sure that they are not cloned sites these scammers uses to attack their victims, we have to verify the acceptance of any offer intended on us in other to know if they are nit set attack at us.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: TravelMug on September 21, 2023, 08:14:09 PMQuote from: tabas on September 20, 2023, 11:20:49 PMIn every claims that we're seeing, there's also those scammers that tries to take advantage of the situation. Thanks OP when you've seen this and we need to alert everyone else upon seeing such fake claimant website or a phishing link that appears to be a copy cat of the legitimate ones. It's not just for the claims of celcius but also for other websites and services that has been gone and out of service already. This isn't going to be the last one that we'll see and there will be new ones that will be made by the scammers behind these fake websites and likely, they've been doing this all of their lifetime. That is so true, and if I'm not mistaken, even the claimants from the Mt. Gox who has been one of the ghost that still haunting us for many years, has been taken advantage by this scammers and made several websites as well, fake ones obviously to trap those victims because it's been years and they want to claim it right now. They'll flock and try to trick people when there's something like this. Poor those people that will fall for this and think that they're the legitimate ones. Quote from: TravelMug on September 21, 2023, 08:14:09 PMSo just be careful guys, this scammers are really that smart to know which incoming projects have filed for bankruptcy and what is the next step for their customers like how to claim and then they created this fake websites.They're all updated of what's happening with claims and as well as other news in the market and community. So if someone is reading this out of nowhere and has the same story of having some claims on Celcius or any other closed service but eligible for that, it is not going to hurt you to take time and sit in your desk reading the validity and authenticity of what these websites are because if you don't, you might fall for one.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: tabas on September 20, 2023, 11:20:49 PMIn every claims that we're seeing, there's also those scammers that tries to take advantage of the situation. Well, i can't say more about this, almost everything that is related to money, a scam counterpart will be created earlier or later on by this scammers. And believe it or not some people will always be get victim for this, wondering how their thoughts work, then later on will blame the legit org/group for their stupidity.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on September 22, 2023, 11:39:24 PMQuote from: tabas on September 20, 2023, 11:20:49 PMIn every claims that we're seeing, there's also those scammers that tries to take advantage of the situation. Well, i can't say more about this, almost everything that is related to money, a scam counterpart will be created earlier or later on by this scammers.And there's proliferation of this on the crypto market and that's why always keep an eye if you ever are into those claiming services and not just them but, in almost every transactions that we do and yes all about money as long as it's involved.Quote from: PX-Z on September 22, 2023, 11:39:24 PMAnd believe it or not some people will always be get victim for this, wondering how their thoughts workOne sad truth that we can't alter and couldn't be changed in the long run. As this space is getting older and bigger, there are those newbies that are always coming in which they're targeted by these scammers.Quote from: PX-Z on September 22, 2023, 11:39:24 PMthen later on will blame the legit org/group for their stupidity.Can't blame themselves for that and just trying to find fault to others with their mistake but they'll have to admit later on that it's on them.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Celsius' clients information have been leaked couple of times hence I wouldn't be surprised if these people get an uptick of phishing emails compared to others.From the infamous court filling to third party vendors leaking their emails ü•±https://decrypt.co/111451/bankrupt-crypto-lender-celsius-reveals-thousands-of-users-transaction-histories-in-court-filinghttps://decrypt.co/66688/celsius-data-breachhttps://www.reddit.com/r/CelsiusNetwork/comments/waidkd/comprised_email_addresses_by_celsius/Bleeping Computer has an interesting bit though about this case. Apparently, someone who doesn't have an account received the same emailQuote from: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/claimants-in-celsius-crypto-bankruptcy-targeted-in-phishing-attack/A recipient of one of these phishing emails told BleepingComputer that they did not have an account at Celsius and never filed as a creditor, making it strange that they received this email.The threat actors are likely using older contact lists previously stolen through hacked cryptocurrency marketing accounts.So perps may have used a general list which came from users of different platforms.
